result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucious J Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lucious J Griffin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lucious J Griffin was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Lucious J Griffin was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lucious J Griffin was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

referral form to bail monitoring

AMENDED CASH BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP 
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his release from jail.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $4,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Crystal G. or Brenda W.-K.
- Defendant shall not be in the 900 or 1000 blocks of Rockefeller Ln in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge - Br 11
